poem:
Ignorance and Bliss

The morning light  
slants across the page,  
crackling wit woven  
with elegance—  
each word a petal,  
gossamer thin  
yet intentional,  
an unfolding bloom.  
Weighty matters drift  
like a wisp  
in a gentle breeze;  
in not knowing,  
find the dance  
of life's  
effortless  
refrain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ignorance and Bliss: On Wanting Not to Know by Mark Lilla review – the enduring power of stupidity This is at once a wise and wonderfully enjoyable book. Mark Lilla treats weighty matters with a light touch, in an elegant prose style that crackles with dry wit. Almost every one of the short sections into which the narrative is divided – and there is a narrative, cunningly sustained within what seems a relaxed discursiveness –". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
